Content.p: Extensible Markup Language, or XML is a well known, internationally accepted way to deal with structured text. The language is used primarily as a transport mechanism for moving properties and content between endpoints.

p.text: is a pure ISO 14882 (C++ / STL) approach for digesting XML content. The library is fully contained in a single header file, and depends only on the Standard Template Library and a few trivial type abstraction definitions.

Content.p: The project offers a unique, but incredibly flexible approach for digesting XML contents into heterogeneous C++ objects.
ExecutableXML is adaptable to international standard io streams, and provides a foundation for modeling complex C++ architectures. The xml can describe anything you want.
